description:
Swirl-String Theory (SST) Lagrangian — Emergent Relativistic EFT with Preferred Foliation
 
Description
This article formulates a covariant effective field theory in which matter and interactions emerge from knotted swirl strings in a condensed vacuum with a preferred foliation. Relativistic symmetry is realized on leaves orthogonal to the clock field \( T(x) \), enforcing \( u^\mu \parallel \partial^\mu T \), \( u_\mu u^\mu = -1 \), and using the projector \( h_{\mu\nu} = g_{\mu\nu} + u_\mu u_\nu \) for leaf dynamics. The action couples a Kalb–Ramond two-form \( B_{\mu\nu} \) with field strength \( H_{\mu\nu\rho} = \partial_{[\mu} B_{\nu\rho]} \) to an emergent swirl gauge sector \( W_\mu \) with curvature \( W_{\mu\nu} \); a topological term \( W^a_{\mu\nu}\,\widetilde W^{\,\mu\nu}_a \) enforces helicity quantization and stabilizes knotted configurations. Fermion rest masses enter as solitonic energies via a calibrated functional fixed by condensate scales and knot invariants.
 
The minimal Lagrangian density is
\( \displaystyle \mathcal{L} \;=\; -\frac{\kappa_\omega}{4}\, W^a_{\mu\nu} W_a^{\mu\nu}\;+\;\frac{\kappa_B}{12}\, H_{\mu\nu\rho} H^{\mu\nu\rho}\;+\;\frac12 (\nabla_\mu \Phi)(\nabla^\mu \Phi)\;-\;V(\Phi)\;+\;\frac{\theta}{4}\, W^a_{\mu\nu}\,\widetilde W_a^{\,\mu\nu}\;+\;\lambda_1 (u_\mu u^\mu + 1)\;+\;\lambda_2 \nabla_\mu u^\mu\;+\;\sum_K \bar\Psi_K \!\left(i\gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_K^{(\mathrm{sol})}\right)\! \Psi_K, \)
with \( H_{\mu\nu\rho} \equiv \partial_{[\mu}B_{\nu\rho]} \), \( \widetilde W_a^{\,\mu\nu} \equiv \tfrac12 \epsilon^{\mu\nu\rho\sigma} W^a_{\rho\sigma} \), and \( D_\mu \equiv \nabla_\mu + i g_{\rm sw} W^a_{\mu} T_a \).
 
Solitonic masses are defined by
\( m_K^{(\mathrm{sol})} = E_K \) and \( m_K^{(\mathrm{sol})} = M_0\,\Xi_K(m,n,s,k;\varphi) \),
with a universal scale \( M_0 \) and a dimensionless knot factor \( \Xi_K \) determined by topology and core geometry.
 
At low energies, conserved knot/helicity data feed a homomorphism
\( \pi:\; G_{\rm sw} \to G_{\rm SM} \equiv SU(3)_c \times SU(2)_L \times U(1)_Y \),
with electric charge \( Q = T_3 + \tfrac12 Y \) fixed by integer topological invariants per species.
 
What’s included
 * PDF: \textit{Swirl-String-Theory\_Lagrangian.pdf} (full derivation of foliation kinematics, \( B_{\mu\nu} \) sector, swirl gauge sector, and solitonic mass functional; includes canonical constraints and anomaly checks).
 
Intended use
 * Canonical EFT reference for SST field content \( (u^\mu,\; h_{\mu\nu},\; B_{\mu\nu},\; H_{\mu\nu\rho},\; W_\mu,\; W_{\mu\nu},\; \Psi_K) \) and the minimal Lagrangian \( \mathcal{L} \).
 * Citation target for the topological mass law \( m_K^{(\mathrm{sol})} = M_0 \Xi_K \) and its calibration strategy.
 * Mapping source from swirl charges to SM charges via \( \pi \) and \( Q = T_3 + \tfrac12 Y \).

Keywords
Swirl-String Theory; preferred foliation; Kalb–Ramond two-form \( B_{\mu\nu} \); Chern–Pontryagin \( W\widetilde W \); emergent gauge sector \( G_{\rm sw} \); knot solitons; helicity; effective field theory; topological mass functional \( \Xi_K \).
 
Suggested citation (plain)
Iskandarani, O. (2025). \textit{Swirl-String Theory (SST) Lagrangian: Emergent Relativistic EFT with Preferred Foliation}. Zenodo. \href{https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16956665}{https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16956665}.
